oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fanny Taliaferro Daybook
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Extract from the daybook of Fanny Taliaferro showing the contract between planters and freedmen.

Fanny Taliaferro Yancy was a schoolteacher of Brownsville, Tennessee and her daybook covers the period of the 1850s to the 1870s. Included are accounts of the Civil War, plantation life, poetry, sewing, household hints, and a smallpox outbreak.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Reconstruction (U.S. history, 1865-1877); Freedmen
Freedmen
